title: What rune page setup should I have?
body:
^Tittle^
I have 10 rune pages, 2 of them that I don't know what to do with them.

Here's my current rune setup: http://www.lolking.net/summoner/na/24624900#runes

Any suggestions?

replies.body: It depends entirely on champ pool, example I am a Riven one trick pony so I have 4 different rune pages specifically for riven. Hard to help with some of the info if you want add me in game adn we can discuss it in more detail

I'm an Azir (RIP)main, but I also play Morgana mid, chogath top and jungle, yorick (sometimes) and Draven.

I don't play a lot of AD champions, so I'm not very concerned about not having a lot of AD rune pages. most of them are for jungle.

Only one I can help with is Draven. last season i had a Draven only in low gold. I run 14% AS speed (3 AS quints), 8 AD reds 1 crit chance red, 9 health yellows, 6 MR blues and 3 Mana regen blues (same page ran by KT Arrow, one of the few people capable of playing Draven in competitive play). Hope this helps with Draven

may I know why AS runes?

I though Draven scales better with AD due to his Q... (more AD means more bonus damage with Q.

Comes down to very specific numbers game, to give the brief and general understanding. Normal ADC page is 2 AS quints and 1 AD, you are basically sacrificing 4ish AD for 4% AS, trading an minuscule amount of damage for 2-3 more autos in a trade (especially combined with proper use of W). The damage added at level 2 is equal to an extra 10-15 AD if i recall the exact math correctly
interesting, I might trya setup like this, thx for the basic explanation
If you want add me, I don't ADC much anymore but I can still help with Draven in particular
Sure, I have some problems when it comes to chasing enemies with Q :S
Correction you are trading 2.25 AD for 4.5% AS...concept still applies but the numbers for the AD quint was wrong

You probably don't need to have separate pages whose only difference is Magic Pen vs Hybrid Pen.  Hybrid Pen is efficient in most cases and is close enough to Magic Pen otherwise that the difference is minor.  I'm referring to pages 2 and 3, if it matters.

I'd honestly recommend using Hybrid Pen instead of Magic Pen in pretty much every case, to save rune pages if for no other reason.

You don't really need an AD and AP page for many champions, since there are usually more efficient setups.  Is this one for Evelynn?

Possible Pages:

* Attack Speed Quints, Attack Speed Marks, Flat Armor Seals, Scaling MR Glyphs  [Autoattack Junglers like Warwick or Master Yi]
* Health Regen Quints, Attack Damage or Hybrid Pen Marks, Flat Armor Seals, Flat/Scaling MR Glyphs [Good for weak early top laners]
* Flat Armor Quints, Scaling Armor Seals, Scaling MR Glyphs, Attack Damage or Hybrid Pen Marks [Good against Riven, Zed, etc]
* Flat MR Quints, Scaling Health Seals, Flat MR Glyphs, Attack Damage or Hybrid Pen Marks [Good against Rumble, Leblanc, etc]
* Flat CDR Quints, Flat CDR Glyphs, Attack Damage Marks, Flat Armor Seals [Nasus]

You can look at my rune pages is you want other ideas.

Thx a lot for you suggestions. I've completely remade my rune pages. I now have:

1. General AP
2. AP against  AD
3. AP against AP
4. General AD
5. ARPen against AP
6. Hybrid AD champion (Yorick) agianst AD
7. Hybrid AD champion (Yorick) against AP
8. AS and AD
9. AS and MS
10. Full AS

any comments?
Consider Health Seals, and Quints, and maybe an Attack Speed page somewhere.

Ar.Pen, Armor, 6x CDR - 3x Scaling MR, AD  -for AD assassins like Rengar, Khazix, Zed, and Talon that also rely on abilities for damage
AD, Armor, Scaling MR, AS -for champions that rely on auto attacks for a large majority of their damage like Warwick, Irelia, and most AD Carries
